comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] This is great! What an awesome method of embarkation. Different day but same fashions I'd say. What a great pic from SLNSW - thank you so much for making the connection :)

Hi ANMM
I haven't been able to ascertain whetehr it's Cavanba or Cavanbar as both seem to be in use but I think it's Cavanba?? - RW
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] I vote for "CAVANBA" as much more turns up in  Trove searches, including images at PictureCoffsHarbour (with a useful ship's history),  but it's one of those annoying time-out sites so I can't link to it.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] I vote CAVANBA too - this is the way the ship is registered and appears on the Miramar ship index :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
